intro: Senecio ranconensis, commonly known as the Rancon's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Senecio ranconensis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
